CSL_Aif2DualBitMap Struct Reference
AIF2 » AIF2 Data Structures

This is a sub-structure in CSL_Aif2Pd(Pe)LinkSetup. This structure is used for configuring the parameters of Pd and Pe dual bit map. More...

#include <csl_aif2.h>

Data Fields

Uint32 Dbm2Map [3]
 

Detailed Description

This is a sub-structure in CSL_Aif2Pd(Pe)LinkSetup. This structure is used for configuring the parameters of Pd and Pe dual bit map.

Field Documentation

Uint32 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::Dbm1Map[4]

bit-by-bit bit map [99:0]. pd_dbm_1map[0].dbm_1map[0] == bit 0 of 100 bits

Uint8 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::Dbm1Mult

DBMF repititions of map1.

Uint8 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::Dbm1Size

DBMF number of bits of bit map1 to use.

Uint32 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::Dbm2Map[3]

bit-by-bit bit map [67:0]. pd_dbm_2map[0].dbm_2map[0] == bit 0 of 68 bits

Uint8 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::Dbm2Size

DBMF number of bits of bit map2 to use.

Uint8 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::DbmX

CPRI Dual Bit Map FSM (DBMF) channel count, sets the max number of AxC supported in a given Link. i.e. for CPRI 4x LTE15MHz this must be set to 7b'0000001 indicating 2 AxC

Uint8 CSL_Aif2DualBitMap::DbmXBubble

DBMF bubble count where 0:indicates 1 bubble of 1 AxC sample (4bytes).OBSAI DBMF assumes 4 AxC samples as a bubble length. A burst of bubbles is inserted only when dictated to do so by the bit maps. This field gives great flexibility in rate matching
